      This function concatenates one type of features to the original concatenated feature vector of a word (it modifies the original vector).
      static <V,X,Y,Z> double[] buildConcatenatedFeatureVector(java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> map1, java.util.HashMap<X,java.lang.Double> map2, java.util.HashMap<Y,java.lang.Double> map3, java.util.HashMap<Z,java.lang.Double> map4, V[] featureList1, X[] featureList2, Y[] featureList3, Z[] featureList4)
      This function builds a concatenated feature vector for a word containing all the types of features, from several feature vectors containing different types of features.
      static double calculateFinalSimilarityScore(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2, SimilarityScoreParts similarityScoreParts1, SimilarityScoreParts similarityScoreParts2, SimilarityScoreParts similarityScoreParts3, SimilarityScoreParts similarityScoreParts4, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> wordFrequencies, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> vectorElementSums, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> vectorElementAbsValueSums, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> vectorLengthSquares, long numberOfAllFeatures, long allWordTypeCount)
      Calculates the final similarity score for two words based on the similarity score parts, the length of the vectors and the vector element sums.
      static <V> SimilarityScoreParts calculateSimilarityByRelation(java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word1Map, java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word2Map, java.lang.Double vectorMean1, java.lang.Double vectorMean2, long numberOfAllFeatures, java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> informationMap)
      This function calculates the numerical and Lin similarity of the feature vectors @param word1Map and @param word2Map (without normalization), with respect to one type of features, so @param word1Map and @param word2Map consists of features of only one type.
      static <V> SimilarityScoreParts calculateSimilarityByRelationForDoubleZeroValuesToo(java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word1Map, java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word2Map, java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Long> featureMap, java.lang.Double vectorMean1, java.lang.Double vectorMean2, long numberOfAllFeatures, java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> informationMap)
      This function calculates the numerical similarity of the feature vectors @param word1Map and @param word2Map (without normalization), with respect to one type of features (so @param word1Map and @param word2Map consists of features of only one type), in case of such similarity measures, where the calculation should take place even if (d1==0 && d2==0).
      static double calculateSimilarityDenominator1ByRelationSubscore(double d1, double d2, java.lang.Double vectorMean1, java.lang.Double vectorMean2)
      Calculates a similarity denominator1 subscore based on two double values for the two word to be compared.

      This function computes the Rbo (Rank-Biased Overlap) similarity of the feature vectors of two words, considering all types of features.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateSimilarityByRelation

        public static <V> SimilarityScoreParts calculateSimilarityByRelation(java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word1Map,
                                                                     java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word2Map,
                                                                     java.lang.Double vectorMean1,
                                                                     java.lang.Double vectorMean2,
                                                                     long numberOfAllFeatures,
                                                                     java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> informationMap)
        This function calculates the numerical and Lin similarity of the feature vectors @param word1Map and @param word2Map (without normalization), with respect to one type of features, so @param word1Map and @param word2Map consists of features of only one type.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of keys in @param tuplesMap1 and in @param tuplesMap2
        Parameters:
        word1Map - a map, in which the features of word1 are stored
        word2Map - a map, in which the features of word2 are stored
        vectorMean1 - the mean of the values in the feature vector of word1
        vectorMean2 - the mean of the values in the feature vector of word2
        numberOfAllFeatures - the number of all features of the given type
        informationMap - a map, in which the information content of features are stored
        Returns:
        the pair, in which the numerical and Lin similarity is stored

      • calculateSimilarityByRelationForDoubleZeroValuesToo

        public static <V> SimilarityScoreParts calculateSimilarityByRelationForDoubleZeroValuesToo(java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word1Map,
                                                                                           java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word2Map,
                                                                                           java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Long> featureMap,
                                                                                           java.lang.Double vectorMean1,
                                                                                           java.lang.Double vectorMean2,
                                                                                           long numberOfAllFeatures,
                                                                                           java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> informationMap)
        This function calculates the numerical similarity of the feature vectors @param word1Map and @param word2Map (without normalization), with respect to one type of features (so @param word1Map and @param word2Map consists of features of only one type), in case of such similarity measures, where the calculation should take place even if (d1==0 && d2==0).
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of keys in @param tuplesMap1 and in @param tuplesMap2
        Parameters:
        word1Map - a map, in which the features of word1 are stored
        word2Map - a map, in which the features of word2 are stored
        featureMap - a map, whose keyset contains all the possible features of a type for a word
        vectorMean1 - the mean of the values in the feature vector of word1
        vectorMean2 - the mean of the values in the feature vector of word2
        numberOfAllFeatures - the number of all features of the given type
        informationMap - a map, in which the information content of features are stored
        Returns:
        the pair, in which the numerical and Lin similarity is stored

      • calculateSimilarityNumaratorByRelationSubscore

        public static double calculateSimilarityNumaratorByRelationSubscore(double d1,
                                                                    double d2,
                                                                    java.lang.Double vectorMean1,
                                                                    java.lang.Double vectorMean2,
                                                                    long numberOfAllFeatures)
        Calculates a similarity numerator subscore based on two double values for the two word to be compared.
        Parameters:
        d1 - the double value for the first word
        d2 - the double value for the second word
        vectorMean1 - the mean of the values in the feature vector of word1
        vectorMean2 - the mean of the values in the feature vector of word2
        numberOfAllFeatures - the number of all features of the given type
        Returns:
        the similarity numerator subscore based on two double values

        public static double calculateSimilarityDenominator1ByRelationSubscore(double d1,
                                                                       double d2,
                                                                       java.lang.Double vectorMean1,
                                                                       java.lang.Double vectorMean2)
        Calculates a similarity denominator1 subscore based on two double values for the two word to be compared.
        Parameters:
        d1 - the double value for the first word
        d2 - the double value for the second word
        vectorMean1 - the mean of the values in the feature vector of word1
        vectorMean2 - the mean of the values in the feature vector of word2
        Returns:
        the similarity denominator1 subscore based on two double values

      • calculateFinalSimilarityScore

        public static double calculateFinalSimilarityScore(java.lang.String word1,
                                                   java.lang.String word2,
                                                   SimilarityScoreParts similarityScoreParts1,
                                                   SimilarityScoreParts similarityScoreParts2,
                                                   SimilarityScoreParts similarityScoreParts3,
                                                   SimilarityScoreParts similarityScoreParts4,
                                                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> wordFrequencies,
                                                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> vectorElementSums,
                                                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> vectorElementAbsValueSums,
                                                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> vectorLengthSquares,
                                                   long numberOfAllFeatures,
                                                   long allWordTypeCount)
        Calculates the final similarity score for two words based on the similarity score parts, the length of the vectors and the vector element sums.
        Parameters:
        word1 - the first word
        word2 - the second word
        similarityScoreParts1 - the similarity score parts for the first type of relation
        similarityScoreParts2 - the similarity score parts for the second type of relation
        similarityScoreParts3 - the similarity score parts for the third type of relation
        similarityScoreParts4 - the similarity score parts for the fourth type of relation
        wordFrequencies - the map containing the frequency of words of a given POS
        vectorElementSums - a map, in which the sum of the elements in feature vectors of a given type are stored
        vectorElementAbsValueSums - a map, in which the sum of the absolute value of the elements in feature vectors of a given type are stored
        vectorLengthSquares - a map, in which the square of the length of feature vectors of a given type are stored
        numberOfAllFeatures - the number of all features of the given type
        allWordTypeCount - the number of all words with the given POS, for which a word vector in the extracted information exists
        Returns:
        the final similarity score for two words

      • signedLbAbsP1

        public static double signedLbAbsP1(double d)
        A function calculating the binary logarithm of a double with +1 smoothing, with the sign of the original value.
        Parameters:
        d - the double
        Returns:
        the binary logarithm of @param d+1, with the sign of the original value

      • signedExp2m1

        public static double signedExp2m1(double d)
        A function calculating the binary exponential of a double multiplied with its sign, -1, with the sign of the original value (the inverse of the signedLbAbsP1 function)
        Parameters:
        d - the double
        Returns:
        the binary exponential of @param d multiplied with its sign, -1, with the sign of the original value

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the logistic value of @param d, -0.5

        Parameters:
        d - the double
        Returns:
        the logit of @param d+0.5

                                                double d)

        Parameters:

        d - the argument of the f function
        Returns:

      • similarityMeasureFInverseFunction

        public static double similarityMeasureFInverseFunction(int type,
                                                       double d,
                                                       long numberOfAllFeatures)
        Calculates the f inverse function value for a similarity measure. In case of the signedExp2m1 function there are minimum and maximum upper bounds as otherwise it would often return Infinity values.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the f inverse function
        d - the argument of the f inverse function
        numberOfAllFeatures - the number of all features in the vector (needed for the shiftedLogit function because of its (-0.5, 0.5) domain)
        Returns:
        the f inverse function value of @param d

      • distanceToSimilarity

        public static double distanceToSimilarity(double distance)
        The function calculating a similarity score from a distance score
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance score
        Returns:
        the similarity score

      • pearsonCorrelationForHashMaps

        public static <V,X,Y,Z> double pearsonCorrelationForHashMaps(java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word1Map1,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<X,java.lang.Double> word1Map2,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<Y,java.lang.Double> word1Map3,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<Z,java.lang.Double> word1Map4,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word2Map1,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<X,java.lang.Double> word2Map2,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<Y,java.lang.Double> word2Map3,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<Z,java.lang.Double> word2Map4,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Long> featureMap1,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<X,java.lang.Long> featureMap2,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<Y,java.lang.Long> featureMap3,
                                                             java.util.HashMap<Z,java.lang.Long> featureMap4,
                                                             double expectedValue1,
                                                             double expectedValue2,
                                                             boolean originalPearson)
        This function computes the Pearson correlation of the feature vectors of two words, considering all types of features. It first calculates the standard deviation for both feature vectors and the covariance of the two feature vectors by calling the stdAndCovarianceForAFeatureType function for every type of features, then it computes the pearson correlation based on the returned values.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of keys in @param word1Map1, @param word2Map1 and in @param featureMap1
        X - the type of keys in @param word1Map2, @param word2Map2 and in @param featureMap2
        Y - the type of keys in @param word1Map3, @param word2Map3 and in @param featureMap3
        Z - the type of keys in @param word1Map4, @param word2Map4 and in @param featureMap4
        Parameters:
        word1Map1 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        word1Map2 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        word1Map3 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        word1Map4 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        word2Map1 - a map, in which one type of features of word2 are stored with weights
        word2Map2 - a map, in which one type of features of word2 are stored with weights
        word2Map3 - a map, in which one type of features of word2 are stored with weights
        word2Map4 - a map, in which one type of features of word2 are stored with weights
        featureMap1 - a map, whose keyset contains all the possible features of a type for a word
        featureMap2 - a map, whose keyset contains all the possible features of a type for a word
        featureMap3 - a map, whose keyset contains all the possible features of a type for a word
        featureMap4 - a map, whose keyset contains all the possible features of a type for a word
        expectedValue1 - the expected value (mean) of the feature vector of word1
        expectedValue2 - the expected value (mean) of the feature vector of word2
        originalPearson - determines whether the original Pearson correlation or only the covariance for (Kiela and Clark, 2014)'s correlation measure is calculated
        Returns:
        the Pearson correlation of the feature vectors of the two words

      • stdAndCovarianceForAFeatureType

        public static <V> ComparablePair<ComparablePair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>,java.lang.Double> stdAndCovarianceForAFeatureType(java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word1Map,
                                                                                                                                     java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word2Map,
                                                                                                                                     java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Long> featureMap,
                                                                                                                                     double expectedValue1,
                                                                                                                                     double expectedValue2)
        This function calculates the standard deviation of @param word1Map and of @param word2Map and their covariance. The feature vector contains only one type of features.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of keys in @param word1Map, @param word2Map and in @param featureMap
        Parameters:
        word1Map - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        word2Map - a map, in which one type of features of word2 are stored with weights
        featureMap - a map, whose keyset contains all the possible features of a type for a word
        expectedValue1 - the expected value (mean) of word1
        expectedValue2 - the expected value (mean) of word2
        Returns:
        the standard deviation of @param word1Map and of @param word2Map and their covariance

      • rankMapForSpearmanCorrelationFromArray

        public static double[] rankMapForSpearmanCorrelationFromArray(double[] scoreMap)
        This function converts the scores stored in @param scoreMap into ranks.
        Parameters:
        scoreMap - a map, which contains instances of V with scores
        Returns:
        a map, which contains the instances of V with ranks

      • pearsonCorrelationForArrays

        public static double pearsonCorrelationForArrays(double[] scoreMap1,
                                                 double[] scoreMap2,
                                                 double exp1,
                                                 double exp2)
        This function computes the Pearson correlation of two maps containing instances of V with scores. First the expected values are calculated, then the standard deviations and the covariance, finally the Pearson correlation is calculated from the other values.
        Parameters:
        scoreMap1 - the first map containing instances of V with scores
        scoreMap2 - the second map containing instances of V with scores
        exp1 - the expected value (mean) of @param scoreMap1
        exp2 - the expected value (mean) of @param scoreMap2
        Returns:
        the Pearson correlation of the two maps

      • buildConcatenatedFeatureVector

        public static <V,X,Y,Z> double[] buildConcatenatedFeatureVector(java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> map1,
                                                                java.util.HashMap<X,java.lang.Double> map2,
                                                                java.util.HashMap<Y,java.lang.Double> map3,
                                                                java.util.HashMap<Z,java.lang.Double> map4,
                                                                V[] featureList1,
                                                                X[] featureList2,
                                                                Y[] featureList3,
                                                                Z[] featureList4)
        This function builds a concatenated feature vector for a word containing all the types of features, from several feature vectors containing different types of features. The features with zero values are also included in this concatenated vector (it is needed for the Spearman correlation).
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of keys in @param map1 and in @param informationMap1
        X - the type of keys in @param map2 and in @param informationMap2
        Y - the type of keys in @param map3 and in @param informationMap3
        Z - the type of keys in @param map4 and in @param informationMap4
        Parameters:
        map1 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        map2 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        map3 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        map4 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        featureList1 - a list, in which one type of features of word1 are stored (including features with weight 0)
        featureList2 - a list, in which one type of features of word1 are stored (including features with weight 0)
        featureList3 - a list, in which one type of features of word1 are stored (including features with weight 0)
        featureList4 - a list, in which one type of features of word1 are stored (including features with weight 0)
        Returns:
        the concatenated feature vector for the word containing all the types of features

      • addOneFeatureTypeToConcatenatedFeatureVector

        public static <V> void addOneFeatureTypeToConcatenatedFeatureVector(double[] concatenatedFeatureMap,
                                                                    int startIndex,
                                                                    java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> map,
                                                                    V[] featureList)
        This function concatenates one type of features to the original concatenated feature vector of a word (it modifies the original vector).
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of keys in @param map and in @param informationMap
        Parameters:
        concatenatedFeatureMap - the original concatenated feature vector
        startIndex - a start index, from where the concatenated feature vector should be filled with new values
        map - a map, in which one type of features of word are stored with weights
        featureList - a list, in which one type of features of word1 are stored (including features with weight 0)

      • rbo

        public static <V,X,Y,Z> double rbo(java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word1Map1,
                                   java.util.HashMap<X,java.lang.Double> word1Map2,
                                   java.util.HashMap<Y,java.lang.Double> word1Map3,
                                   java.util.HashMap<Z,java.lang.Double> word1Map4,
                                   java.util.HashMap<V,java.lang.Double> word2Map1,
                                   java.util.HashMap<X,java.lang.Double> word2Map2,
                                   java.util.HashMap<Y,java.lang.Double> word2Map3,
                                   java.util.HashMap<Z,java.lang.Double> word2Map4)
        This function computes the Rbo (Rank-Biased Overlap) similarity of the feature vectors of two words, considering all types of features.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of keys in @param word1Map1, @param word2Map1 and in @param featureMap1
        X - the type of keys in @param word1Map2, @param word2Map2 and in @param featureMap2
        Y - the type of keys in @param word1Map3, @param word2Map3 and in @param featureMap3
        Z - the type of keys in @param word1Map4, @param word2Map4 and in @param featureMap4
        Parameters:
        word1Map1 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        word1Map2 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        word1Map3 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        word1Map4 - a map, in which one type of features of word1 are stored with weights
        word2Map1 - a map, in which one type of features of word2 are stored with weights
        word2Map2 - a map, in which one type of features of word2 are stored with weights
        word2Map3 - a map, in which one type of features of word2 are stored with weights
        word2Map4 - a map, in which one type of features of word2 are stored with weights
        Returns:
        the Rbo (Rank-Biased Overlap) similarity of the feature vectors of the two words
